| History                 = The '''Rus Vanir''' were a tribe living far north of the [[Eiglophian Mountains|Eiglophians]], in [[Vanaheim (Hyboria)|Vanaheim]], and more exactly on the [[Vanir Marches]].<!-- {{r|Conan the Savage #1|; Hounds to the Slaughter}} -->

They besieged the [[Fort of the Taiga Wood|Fort]] of the [[Taiga Forest|Taiga Wood]], established by the [[Aquilonia]]ns when they pushed their frontier there, and maned by [[Vadis (Earth-616)|Centurion Vadis]] of the [[Black Legions (Aquilonia) (Earth-616)|Ninth]]. They had his slave bribed with [[Vanirgeld]] for him to use arsenic on Vadis and his family. Those deaths were attributed to a curse cast by the [[Witch-Queen of the Rus Vanir (Earth-616)|Witch-Queen of the Rus Vanir]].<!-- {{r|Conan the Savage #1|; Hounds to the Slaughter}} -->

Vadis was replaced by [[Lucius Vindictus (Earth-616)|Lucius Vindictus]]. That very night, Vanir managed to infiltrate the fort, but [[Conan (Earth-616)|Conan]] the [[Cimmeria]]n, mercenary for the fort but chained outside, managed to kill a few, and the the attack was repelled by the Aquilonians. In the ensuing days, Conan helped them fight off the Vanir, first by denouncing the slave's treachery, then by using a [[Hyrkanian Bow|bow]] he took from an [[Hyrkania]]n chieftain to slay the Witch-Queen, using a [[Rosetree]] shaft (a wood sacred to the Vanir). The next day, the Vanir used a ram mounted on skis to breach the fort, and slaughtered everyone in it save for Conan and Lucius Vindictus who managed to escape.{{r|Conan the Savage #1|; Hounds to the Slaughter}}
